ThingDef.Name: carnap_smoothed{stone}Base
ThingDef.label: smoothed {label}
ThingDef.description: {description}. It has been polished to a flat, smooth surface.

li.text: All XML Extensions settings require a restart to be applied!
If you have other stone mods, all duplicate TMaterial stones are disabled by default.
Toggle unique stones. See tooltips for gameplay effects.

li.label: obsidian
li.tooltip: Obsidian is quite brittle and not as good for building. It is however quite beautiful, blocks be sold for good money, and it makes very sharp weapons.

li.label: desert glass
li.tooltip: A semi-transparent rock, meaning mountains will be transparent, and most things made of it will be transparent unless they use special shaders. Stat-wise it is similar to granite.

li.label: chalk
li.tooltip: chalk is really soft. It will be exceptionally easy to mine but it is only slightly more durable than wood logs.

li.label: pumice
li.tooltip: both blocks and chunks are 5 times lighter than other rocks so you can transport it easier, although it is not very durable. Pumice buildings can also be built on normal bridges and platforms that support only light buildings.

li.label: lunar rock
li.tooltip: lunar stone is hard to mine (1400 hit points) and produces very durable blocks (2x max HP).

li.label: meteorite rock
li.tooltip: Even harder to mine (1700 hit points) and produces even more durable blocks (2.4x max HP).

li.label: voidstone (read tooltip)
li.tooltip: Enable if you want a completely black rock (0,0,0). You won't be able to tell floors from walls because both will be pitch black, so playing on voidstone maps is quite annoying! But you can buy it or find and mine with VE outposts, if you want to intentionally use this pitch black effect.

li.text: Toggle stones that are duplicates of stones from other mods you have loaded. Only enable them if you removed them from those mods, otherwise you will get duplicates.

li.label: Enable rock types
li.tooltip: Allows stones that you enabled to generate as rock types. Without this setting, they will only spawn in generated structures like walls, and on traders.

li.label: Enable rock rarity
li.tooltip: Makes common stones actually more common, so not every fifth cell has desert glass. Vanilla stones will be five times more common; some stones from this mod - two to four. A very minor sideffect of this is that you will rarely see duplicate rock types reported on some map tiles, like "rock types: sandtone, sandstone and granite". If Expanded Materials - Stones and Mortars is loaded, stones from it will be five times more common as well. Doesn't touch stones from other mods.
